21.title: "Dr. Strange, Master of Black Magic!"
21.author: story, Stan Lee ; art, Steve Ditko ; lettering, Terry Szenics
21.appears_in: 5 p. in Strange Tales, no. 110 (July 1963); reprinted in Marvel Collectors' Item Classics, no. 3 (June 1966); reprinted in Origins of Marvel Comics (New York : Simon and Schuster, 1974)
notes: SUMMARY: Traveling in the astral plane, here called the "dimension of dreams," Dr. Strange visits his master at a temple high in a mountain somewhere in Asia (Tibet or Nepal?) and helps an unscrupulous businessman find out why he can't sleep at night. I. [Each creator] k. Astral plane. k. Dimension of dreams. k. Masters. k. Temples. k. Asia. k. Tibet. k. Nepal. k. Unscrupulous businessmen. k. Businessmen. k. Sleep. k. Dreams. k. 27.heading: Asia.
27.title: "O Sabio e os Elefantes"
27.author: A
27.appears_in: B.J. p. 1 in O Tico-Tico : Jornal das Crianças, no. 3 (Oct. 25, 1905).
notes: Summary (by M. Harbeck): The sage Kienkiviski is on a scientific exploration in Asia and wants to take a bath in a pond when suddenly a group of elephants arrive emptying the pond because they have been thirsty. They leave, taking the sage's clothes with them, but he is just relieved that they didn't drink him.

93.appears_in: Lent. p. 1-5 in International Journal of Comic Art, v. 8, no. 2 (Fall 2006).

225.title: "10 Things You Should Know About Comics"
225.author: by Mark Askwith, Walter Dickinson, Rick Taylor, Ron Kasman

230.heading: Asleep.
230.title: The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55
230.author: [No author]

231.heading: Asleep.
231.title: "Brahms Lullaby"
231.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Mr. Thurston has fallen asleep on a park bench while jogging; Chip picks up his headphones to hear what Thirsty had been listening to.

232.heading: Asleep.
232.title: "I Used Ether to Keep Him Asleep"
232.author: Falk & Barry.
notes: Key words: Needles, drugs, courtrooms, colonels.

233.heading: Asleep.
233.title: "Stretching her Leg"
233.author: by Frank Cho.
notes: Summary: Brandy's leg is asleep, and Frank's whole body goes numb.

234.title: "Asleep Again, Beetle?"
234.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Sarge sends Beetle to see the doctor because he sleeps too much, and the doctor is asleep at his desk.

235.title: "Asleep at the Switch!"
235.author: by Gus Edson.
notes: Summary: Andy dozes while standing guard, and a hand holds a bottle of ether under his nose.
